title: IRSA releases 129,300 cusecs water
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 03 (APP):Indus River System Authority (IRSA) on Friday released 129,300 cusecs of water from various rim stations with inflow of 131,800 cusecs.
According to the data released by IRSA, Tarbela Dam has already attained its maximum conservation level of 1550.00 feet, which was 148.00 feet higher than the dead level of 1402.00 feet. Water inflow and outflow in the dam were recorded as 81,000 cusecs and 80,600 cusecs, respectively.
The water level in the River Jhelum at Mangla Dam was 1240.85 feet, which was 190.85 feet higher than its dead level of 1,050 feet. The inflow and outflow of water was recorded as 10,300 cusecs and 8,000 cusecs respectively.
The release of water at Kalabagh, Taunsa, Guddu and Sukkur was recorded as 93,600, 72,300, 125,000, and 69,300 cusecs, respectively. Similarly, from River Kabul, a total of 10,200 cusecs of water was released at Nowshera, and 17,600 cusecs were released from River Chenab at Marala.
